title: Introduction to the STAGE Model
text: STAGE model (State Transition Analysis via Generative Estimation) Bayesian generative classifier designed estimate maturity transition points class distribution : uniform (plateau) region, Gaussian tail, transition point m50, width d. STAGE can fit single population hierarchically multiple populations.

title: Introduction to the STAGE Model
text: simulate simple dataset: Fit STAGE model:
code: N <- 200 L <- 1000 U <- 1500 true_m50 <- 1250 true_d   <- 100  x <- runif(N, L, U) p <- plogis((x - true_m50) / (true_d/4)) y <- rbinom(N, 1, p) fit <- fit_stage(x, y, L = L, U = U, chains = 2, iter = 1000) fit

title: Introduction to the STAGE Model
text: returns posterior summary statistics global transition point (m50).

title: Introduction to the STAGE Model
code: x_grid <- seq(L, U, length.out = 200) p_hat <- predict(fit, x_grid, type = "prob")  plot(   x_grid, p_hat, type = "l",   xlab = "x", ylab = "P(mature)", las = 1 )

title: Introduction to the STAGE Model
text: yields : global m50 population-specific m50_pop[j].
code: group <- rep(c("A", "B"), each = N/2)  fit2 <- fit_stage(x, y, group = group, L = L, U = U, chains = 2, iter = 1000)  transition_point(fit2)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: stage package implements STAGE model (State Transition Analysis via Generative Estimation), Bayesian generative classifier designed estimate transition points (e.g., length--maturity) class distribution contains: plateau (uniform region), Gaussian tail, shared transition region parameterised global transition point m50 width d. package currently provides: fit_stage() – fit STAGE model (single multiple populations) transition_point() – extract posterior summaries m50 predict.stage_fit() – predict class probabilities labels stage_priors() – helper set priors get_cmdstan_model() – internal Stan compiler helper Support HOF logistic model Bayesian LDA added next.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: need cmdstanr installed CmdStan compiled: install stage GitHub:
code: install.packages("cmdstanr",   repos = c("https://mc-stan.org/r-packages/", getOption("repos")) ) cmdstanr::install_cmdstan()   # run once # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("YOUR_GITHUB_USERNAME/stage")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Extract estimated transition point (m50): Prediction:
code: library(stage)  set.seed(123)  N <- 200 L <- 1000 U <- 1500 true_m50 <- 1250 true_d   <- 100  # simulate data x <- runif(N, L, U) p <- plogis((x - true_m50) / (true_d / 4)) y <- rbinom(N, 1, p)  # fit STAGE model (single population) fit <- fit_stage(x, y, L = L, U = U, chains = 2, iter = 1000) fit transition_point(fit) x_grid <- seq(L, U, length.out = 100) p_hat <- predict(fit, x_grid, type = "prob")  plot(x_grid, p_hat, type = "l",      xlab = "x", ylab = "P(mature)", las = 1)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: interface fits multiple populations: returns: global m50 population-specific m50_pop[1], m50_pop[2], …
code: group <- rep(c("A","B"), each = N/2)  fit2 <- fit_stage(x, y, group = group, L = L, U = U)  transition_point(fit2)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: STAGE model generative classifier tailor-made length--maturity similar transition problems. class distribution consists : Uniform plateau (flat region) Gaussian decay/approach transition zone sigma_x – Gaussian width d – width transition region m50 – location transition hierarchical fits: using non-centred parameterisation robust sampling.
